item.title: Mahalo and Farewell
item.description:
To exist is to change, to change is to mature, to mature is to go on creating oneself endlessly. - Henri Bergson

In the last 4 years, I had the opportunity of working in many different software projects and environments. From large companies to small startups, I feel accomplished because I learned what I needed to become the engineer I wanted. And as I advance my career, it's clear that it's time to say goodbye to chmod a+x singularity.sh.

But it's fun to look back! So let's do this...

I started this website in 2014 when I was about to graduate from my Ph.D. in Physics in Stony Brook. Those were the days when I was so so thirsty about learning everything about computers! I wrote an entire book on Python & Algorithms, and I was playing CTF intensively and top 23th at CTFTimes.org. I had that üî• to learn everything and write about everything (hence the variety of topics that this blog has üòÖ).

But my history of building nerdy sites with nerdy content goes way back in the day üòÉ I wrote my first Flash website when I was 11, it was called http://fly.to/bytegirl:

Funny how I had texts on AI and C++ and Java back then... Certain things don't change (but MP3s do ü§£).

Then I created another website when I was in college:

And then when I was in my Ph.D. (so many papers in this one!):

Finally, I wrote singularity.sh, and I feel like my journey has ended with style üëæ.

Thank you all for following my work, for reading my posts, and for cheering my story. It has been an honor to be here.

Mahalo,

Mia (aka bytegirl or bt3) ‚ô•Ô∏è

Oh, before I leave, here is a list of posts that I enjoyed the most:

  • Introducing Amigo, a tool to manage Google Cloud Platform Security.
  • Wireshark for fun or profit.
  • The Ultimate Linux Guide for Hackers.
  • The effects of Convolutional Neural Networks on a Hot Summer Night.
  • Introducing Threat Intel.
  • A Tor Proxy in a Raspberry Pi.
  • Ouroboros Statement.
  • Black Hat Python: Infinite possibilities with the Scapy Module.
  • Black Hat Python: Building a UDP Scanner.
  • Understanding the Shellshock Vulnerability.
  • Stripe's First CTF.
  • Lots of Astrophysics for You.
  • Exploiting the Web in 20 Lessons.
  • Smashing the Stack for Fun or WarGames.
item.dc:creator: Mia Steinkirch
